intro: Gnidia usafuae, commonly known as the Usafu gnidia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal. Gnidia usafuae is often found in rocky or sandy soils in coastal and mountainous regions.
